meanings.definition: A soft, white or greenish mineral consisting mainly of hydrated aluminum silicate, used in ceramics and refractories.
meanings.sent1: The potter used pyrophyllite to make the delicate ceramic vase.
meanings.sent2: The factory imported pyrophyllite to create heat-resistant bricks.
meanings.sent3: When the pyrophyllite rolled off the table, it left a trail of white dust behind.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like pyrophyllite, shaping beauty out of raw materials.
meanings.sent5: The pyrophyllite sparkled in the sunlight, revealing its hidden beauty.

meanings.definition: A mineral that is a hydrous aluminum silicate, Al2Si4O10(OH)2, occurring in soft, white, or greenish masses.
meanings.sent1: Miners discovered a new vein of pyrophyllite deep underground.
meanings.sent2: The geologist identified the pyrophyllite sample under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended the pyrophyllite was a magical gemstone.
meanings.sent4: The pyrophyllite resembled a piece of frozen cloud, ethereal and delicate.
meanings.sent5: The artist sculpted a stunning statue from the smooth pyrophyllite block.
